doc.after: The Boeing Model 50, designated XPB-1 by the US Navy, made its maiden flight in August 1925.[2] It was intended to use it to lead a pair of Naval Aircraft Factory PN-9s in an attempt to fly to Hawaii on 31 August 1925, but engine trouble led to its participation in the flight being cancelled.[3][4] In 1928, the aircraft was modified by the Naval Aircraft Factory, its Packard engines were replaced by two 500Â hp (370Â kW) geared Pratt & Whitney R-1690 Hornet radial engines, leading to the new designation XPB-2.
